Treatment Title: Replace all openings required in floor slabs with precast  service openings.
Avoid holes - consider alternatives to achieve design purposes.
Consider use of transition blocks for services to pass through.
Consider Steel frame construction with composite floor slabs
Design alternative solutions to the opening
Combine multiple penetrations in to lesser number
Cast in mesh in openings to reduce risk of person falling through.
Reduce hole sizes.
Consider forming full slab and cutting out openings when needed
Consider Location of penetration
Group small floor openings together to create one large opening.
Locate floor openings away from passageways, work areas, and the structure perimeter.
Engage Structural engineer with architects to assist in design of handrail and guard elements.
Engage with contractors and temp. works at appointment.
Avoid low walls in circulation areas.
Avoid hidden alcoves and offsets.
Design solution should consider construction and in-use needs.
Consider the floor material to prevent slippery surface near openings.
Avoid trap hazards near openings.
Design permanent grating in opening, to be installed when opening is created during construction.

Identify covering strong enough to support any loads likely to be placed on it ; and fixed in position to prevent accidental dislodgement.

Use safety nets fixed directly below the opening.

Treatment Title: Avoid designing equipment or elevated features next to roof edges.
Avoid roof mounted extractors that require manual inspection or maintenance
Where necessary to locate equipment within 3m from edge of roof, provide railings or means of securing fall protection devices with appropriate signage.
Integrate upstands at edge details.
Preferably design minimum 1.1. m height parapets or railings at all roof edges.
Avoid specifying fragile materials for skylights.
Structural engineer liaises with architects during design phase to assist in design of handrail and guard elements.
Gantry systems can be designed to maintain atriums and skylights.
Provide adequate railing or other means of fall protection along exposed perimeter of the building
Provide safe access directly to all roof levels or from level to level (protected ladder, ships ladder, stairs).
If height parapets or railings at all roof edges of min 1.1 are not designed, alternatively, provide safety line anchor points along all roof edges.
Provide re-bars in skylight frame to avoid fall if skylight should break.
Guard  every skylight opening and hole by skylight screen or a fixed standard railing on all exposed sides.
Install permanent anchorage points on roof slabs to provide permanent anchor points for fall arrest systems.

Ensure swl floor slabs is adequate to support MEWPs  for fixing at height.
Provide adequate safety standards for installing joist.

Treatment Title: Avoid designing In-situ stairways.

Allow time and resources during design to identify risks associated with starwells and evaluate alternative treatments
Consider whether early fixing of stairs will benefit emergency evacuation, or access by all trades
Avoid stair landings constructed separate from the stairs.
Maintain a uniform stair slope throughout the project.
The spacing between vertical stair rails should be less than 100 mm to prevent children’s legs from slipping through the gap.
Provide railing on all exposed sides (except at entrance to stairway)

Treatment Title: Acoustic specialist to carry out risk study to understand best options to reducing noise in the plant room by design
Consider new alternative equipment with less noise
Design Plant rooms with acoustic enclosure
Select Plant that includes acoustic enclosure and anti-vibration mounts
Select Plant to meet atmospheric noise limits
Consider use of mobile noise screens to protect workers from noisy areas
Construction equipment and temporary sources of noise to be assessed and reduced as far as possible

Treatment Title: Provide safety equipment where required (ear defenders)

Treatment Title: Designate and clearly signpost areas of noisy work

Treatment Title: Architect to review options for guard rail solutions for safety
Review walking surfaces on open roof terraces where pedestrians would gather
Design and manufacture guard rail with the correct standards
Introduce Working at Perimeter Edge Safety Procedure
Contractor to ensure suitable edge protection and fall arrest during installation and construction
Contractor to be informed of the need for a WAPE training
PC to ensure competent contractor installs guard rail
Allow access to installation with an exclusion zone to WAPE trained personal

Treatment Title: Inform client that no furniture that could be used as a step up or ladder to be placed alongside guard rail

Housekeeping checks at roof level

Treatment Title: Remove any loose items

Treatment Title: Avoid holes - consider alternatives to achieve design purposes.
Install GRP or similar system to cover any voids for subsequent MEP installation
Every temporary floor opening shall be constantly attended by someone.

Inspect soil as it is excavated and stop if any unkown material is found

Treatment Title: Glass to be designed and tested for maintenance load
Consider options for asbestos removal or treatment to enable the project work to continue without risk
Review the ceiling structure (e.g. services, rooflights, air conditioning, etc) in order to identify any hidden risks associated with asbestos materials in the ceiling
Ask the owner to provide an asbestos register, and management plan. Carry out a desktop survey and if necessary follow up with an asbestos survey
Evaluate the type of asbestos present to decide on appropriate remediation methods
Update asbestos register after removing, treating or identifying asbestos
Carry out a refurbishment and demolition (R&D) survey prior to construction work
Produce a report on asbestos findings and ensure it is submitted to the relevant stakeholders
Ensure that the design team have the knowledge and skill to manage the problem
Design review to review impacts of any discovery of asbestos and how to manage communications with the client
Consider applying non-intrusive encapsulation to any contaminated sheet
Look at potential people at risk and type and severity of exposure to inform construction work
Seal the area to restrict access of unauthorised people
Protect nearby areas with polythene sheeting or a mini-enclosure
Ensure there is a proper induction and emergency procedures for inadvertant discovery of asbestos
Ensure that competent advice is obtained on whether work should be carried out by an HSE-licensed contractor
Use approve techniques to control dust when carrying out work
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Ensure there is a proper procedure for handing over asbestos risk information informing the management plan
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Plan at preliminary design stage for adequate compartmentation, and fire  alarms
Produce a written fire safety plan
Carry out  checks, inspections and tests throughout the construction of the site
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Client duty to evaluate risks from high and extensive scaffold works
Carry out a risk study to identify areas where scaffolding works can be reduced or eliminated by permanaent works design, use of MMC, other access technologies etc.
Consider using a mast climber working platform instead of scaffolds
Identify scaffolding elements that require specialist design
Make sure that the selected scaffold can support the loads of the scheduled activities
Ensure that the base or foundation of the scaffold has been properly assessed and is capable of supporting the weight of the scaffold and loads likely to be placed on it
Make sure that scaffolding is seggregated from vehicles to prevent collisions
Make sure that scaffolding is seggregated from the public and access is controlled
Ensure that CPP has arrangements for planning, monitor and managing scaffold works
Regularly inspect scaffolding
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Supervise alterations and minor adjustments to scaffolds by trained and competent person
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control
